quotes.author: Emil Artin
quotes.quote: It is my experience that proofs involving matrices can be shortened by 50% if one throws the matrices out.

quotes.author: Dave Barry
quotes.quote: Americans who travel abroad for the first time are often shocked to discover that, despite all the progress that has been made in the last 30 years, many foreign people still speak in foreign languages.

quotes.author: Martin Vanbee
quotes.quote: If your foot slips, you may recover your balance, but if your tongue slips, you cannot recall your words.

quotes.author: Jean Dieudonné
quotes.quote: There is hardly any theory which is more elementary than linear algebra, in spite of the fact that generations of professors and textbook writers have obscured its simplicity by preposterous calculations with matrices.

quotes.author: Hermann Weyl
quotes.quote: The introduction of numbers as coordinates is an act of violence.

quotes.author: Morpheus
quotes.quote: Unfortunately, no one can be told what the Matrix is. You have to see it for yourself.

quotes.author: Czech proverb
quotes.quote: You live a new life for every new language you speak.  If you know only one language, you live only once.

quotes.author: Angus K. Rodgers
quotes.quote: Mathematics requires a small dose, not of genius, but of an imaginative freedom which, in a larger dose, would be insanity.

quotes.author: Christopher W. Alexander
quotes.quote: Within this process, every individual act of building is a process in which space gets differentiated. It is not a process of addition, in which preformed parts are combined to create a whole, but a process of unfolding, like the evolution of an embryo, in which the whole precedes the parts, and actually gives birth to them, by splitting.

quotes.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
quotes.quote: Those who know nothing of foreign languages know nothing of their own.

quotes.author: Chancellor Edward Lee Gorsuch
quotes.quote: Learning a foreign language not only reveals how other societies think and feel, what they have experienced and value, and how they express themselves, it also provides a cultural mirror in which we can more clearly see our own society.

quotes.author: Kurt Vonnegut
quotes.quote: The reason creatures wanted to use language instead of mental telepathy was that they found out they could get so much more done with language. Language made them so much more active. Mental telepathy, with everybody constantly telling everybody everything, produced a sort of generalized indifference to all information. But language, with its slow, narrow meanings, made it possible to think about one thing at a time -- to start thinking in terms of projects.

quotes.author: Kurt Vonnegut
quotes.quote: Of all the words of mice and men, the saddest are, 'It might have been.'

quotes.author: Paul Erdős
quotes.quote: It is not enough to be in the right place at the right time. You should also have an open mind at the right time.

quotes.author: Eric S. Raymond
quotes.quote: Given enough eyeballs, all bugs are shallow.

quotes.author: Harold Abelson & Gerald Jay Sussman
quotes.source: The Structure and Interpretation of Computer Programs
quotes.quote: Programs must be written for people to read, and only incidentally for machines to execute.

quotes.author: Aristotle
quotes.quote: It is the mark of an educated mind to entertain an idea without accepting it.

quotes.author: /u/PeelerNo44
quotes.quote: All of the people that have passed through your life have added themselves to a rich tapestry of your life story, and you to theirs in kind. We rarely travel this journey through life together with any given person for very long, but that does not detract from the value of having travelled it with them for the time we've had.

quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quotes.quote: Being perfectly well-dressed gives one a tranquility that no religion can bestow.

quotes.author: Gore Vidal
quotes.quote: Style is knowing who you are, what you want to say, and not giving a damn.

quotes.author: Giorgio Armani
quotes.quote: Elegance is not standing out, but being remembered.

quotes.author: Aaron Swartz (?)
quotes.quote: Be curious. Read widely. Try new things. What people call intelligence just boils down to curiosity.

quotes.author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana
quotes.quote: A blank check kills creativity.

quotes.author: Epictetus
quotes.quote: When you are offended at any man's fault, turn to yourself and study your own failings. Then you will forget your anger.

quotes.author: Epictetus
quotes.quote: It's not what happens to you, but how you react to it that matters.

quotes.author: Epictetus
quotes.quote: Any person capable of angering you becomes your master; he can anger you only when you permit yourself to be disturbed by him.

quotes.author: Epictetus
quotes.quote: Other people's views and troubles can be contagious. Don't sabotage yourself by unwittingly adopting negative, unproductive attitudes through your associations with others.

quotes.author: Epictetus
quotes.quote: If a person gave away your body to some passerby, you’d be furious. Yet, you hand over your mind to anyone who comes along, so they may abuse you, leaving it disturbed and troubled — have you no shame in that?

quotes.author: Epictetus
quotes.quote: If you want to improve, be content to be thought foolish and stupid.

quotes.author: Epictetus
quotes.quote: Man is not worried by real problems so much as by his imagined anxieties about real problems.

quotes.author: Epictetus
quotes.quote: Wealth consists not in having great possessions, but in having few wants.

quotes.author: Epictetus
quotes.quote: It is impossible for a man to learn what he thinks he already knows.

quotes.author: Epictetus
quotes.quote: Don't seek to have events happen as you wish, but wish them to happen as they do happen, and all will be well with you.

quotes.author: Epictetus
quotes.quote: Those who are well constituted in the body endure both heat and cold: and so those who are well constituted in the soul endure both anger and grief and excessive joy and the other affects.

quotes.author: Kakuzō Okakura
quotes.quote: The art of life lies in a constant readjustment to our surroundings.

quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche
quotes.quote: Be careful when you cast out your demons that you don't throw away the best of yourself.

quotes.author: Steve Prefontaine
quotes.quote: Somebody may beat me, but they are going to have to bleed to do it.

quotes.author: Steve Prefontaine
quotes.quote: To give anything less than your best is to sacrifice the gift.

quotes.author: Steve Prefontaine
quotes.quote: A lot of people run a race to see who is the fastest. I run to see who has the most guts, who can punish himself into exhausting pace, and then at the end, punish himself even more.

quotes.author: Steve Prefontaine
quotes.quote: It's not who's the best — it's who can take the most pain.

quotes.author: Robert Greene
quotes.quote: When you meet a swordsman, draw your sword: Do not recite poetry to one who is not a poet.

quotes.author: Elizabeth Taylor
quotes.quote: The problem with people who have no vices is that generally you can be pretty sure they're going to have some pretty annoying virtues.

quotes.author: Oscar Wilde
quotes.quote: A bore is someone who deprives you of solitude without providing you with company.

quotes.author: Miyamoto Musashi
quotes.quote: Truth is not what you want it to be; it is what it is, and you must bend to its power or live a lie.

quotes.author: Edward de Bono
quotes.quote: Many highly intelligent people are poor thinkers. Many people of average intelligence are skilled thinkers. The power of a car is separate from the way the car is driven.

quotes.author: Edward de Bono
quotes.quote: Everyone has the right to doubt everything as often as he pleases and the duty to do it at least once. No way of looking at things is too sacred to be reconsidered. No way of doing things is beyond improvement.

quotes.author: Edward de Bono
quotes.quote: The image that concerns most people is the reflection they see in other people's minds.

quotes.author: Edward de Bono
quotes.quote: An idea that is developed and put into action is more important than an idea that exists only as an idea.

quotes.author: Edward de Bono
quotes.quote: Democracy is an excellent way of ensuring that nothing much gets done. There are always interests that might get trampled upon [and no elected politician would wish to make permanent enemies by trampling upon others' interests].

quotes.author: Edward de Bono
quotes.quote: Unfortunately, our existing traditional thinking habits insist that you must attack something and show it to be bad before you can suggest a change. It is more difficult to acknowledge that something is excellent and then to ask for change because although it is excellent, it is not enough.
